snippet: India’s veto of a W.T.O. agreement on customs rules will erode confidence in the global trading system.
abstract: Editorial holds India's veto of World Trade Organization's final agreement on customs rules will further erode confidence in global trading system; warns that country's insistence on subsidizing its own farmers, by buying wheat and grain at above-market prices and accumulating more than it needs, pushes Western officials to focus on more regional and industry-specific trade deals, which leaves out poorest and smallest nations.
lead_paragraph: India’s veto of a W.T.O. agreement on customs rules will erode confidence in the global trading system.

headline.main: Global Trade Talks Suffer Another Setback
headline.print_headline: Global Trade Talks Suffer Another Setback
